extra.message: Login is a state-changing MVC method that does not validate the antiforgery token or do strict content-type checking. State-changing controller methods should either enforce antiforgery tokens or do strict content-type checking to prevent simple HTTP request types from bypassing CORS preflight controls.

extra.message: RegExp() called with a `params` function argument, this might allow an attacker to cause a Regular Expression Denial-of-Service (ReDoS) within your application as RegExP blocks the main thread. For this reason, it is recommended to use hardcoded regexes instead. If your regex is run on user-controlled input, consider performing input validation or use a regex checking/sanitization library such as https://www.npmjs.com/package/recheck to verify that the regex does not appear vulnerable to ReDoS.
